ACT
251
Award and costs
Article 251.
The reward and expenses of a notary public as a trustee of the judicial authority in the implementation of probate proceedings are determined in such a way that, as a rule, one reward pertains to all actions of the notary public in a particular probate proceeding.
The Ordinance on the reward for conducting probate proceedings will prescribe for which actions a notary public is entitled to a special reward (list of probate, etc.).
When a notary acts as a court commissioner in a probate proceeding, no notary fee is payable.
